fields.name: Device ID
fields.description:
Device identification number. The maximum length is 10 digits.
Only integer can be used. Default device ID is 2000000001
Note:
The most left digit is reserved in which must be ‘2’.

fields.name: New Password
fields.description: New password of the device. Default is “0000”

fields.name: PIN Code
fields.description:
The PIN Code of the SIM card. The maximum length is 8 digits.
Note:
Please use to clear parameter.

fields.name: Input 1 delay time interval
fields.description: Effect time interval 0~255 100ms

fields.name: Input 2 delay time interval
fields.description: Effect time interval 0~255 100ms

fields.name: Input 3 delay time interval
fields.description: Effect time interval 0~255 100ms

fields.name: Input 4 delay time interval
fields.description: Effect time interval 0~255 100ms

commands.description:
Execute this command to configure the device ID, device password, PIN code of the
SIM card, and the delay time for input ports (input 1~4)

commands.note:
1) If primary communication is GPRS then both parameters “SMSPhone No.” and
“CSD Phone No.” are not required.
2) The port number of GPRS_Server_Port parameter must be opened for the control
center software and not conflict with others port which is occupied by OS or other
software.
3) Please enable the GPRS service for the SIM card before start GPRS configuration.
Also, please obtain related information such as “Access Point Name” (APN), user
name (if applicable), and password (if applicable) for GPRS configuration
($WP+COMMTYPE command).
4) The Static IP address is required for the GPRS communication. Sometimes the
failure of GPRS connection is caused by the firewall setting enabled.
5) The software developer must implement the function in the control center software
in which must echo back exact GPRS Keep_Alive packet back to the device once
the base station receives the GPRS Keep_Alive packet which was sent from the
device to confirm the GPRS connection.
6) The performance of the GPRS connectivity might be affected by the Keep_Alive
packet interval due to the TELCO policy for the dynamic IP address source control.
The optimized Keep_Alive Packet interval needs to be tested in the local area in
order to obtain the optimized interval (cost effective).
7) Keep_Alive message format (Data transmission by Hex format)
typedef struct
{
unsigned short Keep_Alive_Header;
unsigned short Keep_Alive_ID;
unsigned long Keep_Alive_Device_ID;
} Keep_Alivestruct;
Keep_Alive_Header is always 0xD7D0
Keep_Alive_ID is the sequence number for the Keep_Alive message
Keep_Alive_Device ID is the device identification number. The base station could
use this information to recognize the current holding dynamic IP for each device.
Ex:, received Synchronization message following:
0xD0 0xD7 0x1A 0x01 0xC7 0x54 0x44 0x3C
Keep_Alive_Header = 0xD7 0xD0
Keep_Alive_ID = 0x01 0x1A (Decimal = 282)
Keep_Alive_Device_ID = 0x3C 0x44 0x54 0xC7 (Decimal = 1011111111)
8) If the control center software is installed in a computer which is located in the
“Intranet” then the parameter “GPRS_Server_IP” address should be the external
one which connects to the router and the parameter “GPRS_Server_Port” should
be the port number of the computer which is assigned by the router. If the
parameter “GPRS_Server_IP” address is using “Virtual IP address” in the intranet
then it will lead to the GPRS connection failure.
9) If the device is configured under GPRS mode (GPRS UDP/TCP), the device will
send the acknowledgement for the receiving command or returning message back
to the GMS SMS base phone number once the device receives the command from
a GSM SMS phone number other than GSM SMS base phone number. If the GSM
SMS base phone number is not set then the device will take the parameters but will
not returning any message back to GSM SMS base phone number or GPRS
server.
10) Please be aware that if the GSM base phone number is not set, the device has
following behaviors:
- If the device receives any valid incoming command via GSM SMS, the device will
execute the command, but all acknowledgements or returning message will NOT
be sent and will be ignored.
- If the device is configured under GPRS mode (GSM base phone number is set),
if the device receives any valid incoming GSM command from a phone number
other than GSM base phone number then the device will execute this command
and return all acknowledgements and returning messages back to the GSM base
phone number.
11) If this command is issued over GSM SMS, please be aware the text length
limitation of the GSM message.

fields.name: CommSelect
fields.description:
Set primary communication type:
1. GSM SMS communication
2. CSD: Circuit Switched Data communication
(Reserved, currently not support)
3. GPRS UDP communication
4. GPRS TCP/IP communication
5. USB port communication
Note:
Support COM numbers: COM 1~ COM 199 auto detection.

fields.name: SMS Base Phone No.
fields.description:
Base phone number for the GSM SMS base station. Maximum
length is 16 digits (could be ignored if uses GPRS
communication).
Note: Please use “” to clear the parameter.

fields.name:
CSD Base Phone
No.
fields.description:
Base phone number for the GSM Circuit Switched Data
communication. Maximum length is 16 digits (could be ignored
if uses GPRS communication).
Note: Please use “” to clear the parameter.

fields.name: GPRS_APN
fields.description:
Access Point Name for GPRS service (required for GPRS
communication) The maximum length is 40 characters.
Note: Please use “” to clear the parameter.

fields.name: GPRS_Username
fields.description:
User name for GPRS service if applicable.
The maximum length is 31 characters.
Note: Please use “” to clear the parameter.

fields.name: GPRS_Password
fields.description:
Password for GPRS service if applicable.
The maximum length is 20 characters

fields.name:
GPRS_Server_
IP_Address
fields.description:
Default setting: 0.0.0.0
1. Static IP address:
format xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx (Please do not use virtual IP
address)
2. Host/Domain Name (GPRS_DNS server must be defined)
for the base station. The maximum length is 40 characters.

fields.name:
GPRS_Server_
Port
fields.description:
The port IP of the computer which the control center software
is operating. The available range is from 1000~65535.
Default setting: 1000

fields.name:
GPRS_Keep_Alive
Packet Interval
fields.description:
GPRS Keep_Alive Packet is used to establish the GPRS
connection and maintain the GPRS connectivity between the
device and the base station. The range is between 0~65535
seconds.
Default setting: 30 seconds
Note:
Set to ‘0’ to disable sending GPRS Keep_Alive Packet. This
parameter will not send any Keep_Alive Packet to the control
center.

fields.name:
GPRS_DNS
Server
fields.description:
Domain Name System IP address. Please contact local ISP for
the IP address of DNS server. Please use the xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx
as the format for this parameter.
Default setting: 168.95.1.1

commands.description:
Execute this command to set the primary communication type and its related
parameters

fields.name: Enable/Disable
fields.description:
0. Disable GPRS roaming function
1. Enable GPRS roaming function

commands.description:
Execute this command to enable/disable GPRS roaming function. This command does
not affect GSM SMS roaming service. If GPRS roaming function is disabled, the device
will automatically closed the GPRS session and all undelivered messages would be
stored in the queue buffer. Those undelivered messages would be sent out whenever
the device returns the non-GPRS roaming network.
Execute this command to get current position of the device

fields.name: Mode
fields.description:
0. Disable (Stop tracking)
1. Time mode:
The position information is sent to the base station according to
the required time interval, only whole number can be used.
Effective range for different communication types:
Direct Connection: 1~65535 seconds.
GSM SMS: 15~65535 seconds
GSM CSD: 5~65535 seconds
GPRS UDP/TCP/IP: 5~65535 seconds.

2. Distance mode:
The position information is sent to the base station according to
the required distance interval, only whole number can be used.
Effective range for different communication types:
Direct Connection: 25~65535 meters.
GSM SMS: 300 ~65535 meters.
GSM CSD: 100~65535 meters.
GPRS UDP/TCP/IP: 100~65535 meters.

3. Time AND Distance:
The position information is sent back to the base station when
following BOTH conditions are satisfied:
a. “Time Interval” is reached.
b. “Distance Interval” is reached.

4. Time OR Distance
The position information is sent to the base station when one of the
following condition is satisfied:
a. “Time Interval” is reached.
b. “Distance Interval” is reached.

5. Heading mode:
The position information is sent when the “Heading (direction)”
parameter is changed beyond the assigned degrees. Please
enter the required value in the “Heading” column.

6. Heading OR Time
The position information is sent back to the base station when
one of the following condition is satisfied:
a. “Heading (direction)” parameter is changed beyond the
assigned degrees
b. Required “Time Interval” is reached.

7. Heading OR Distance
The position information is sent whenever one of the following
condition is satisfied:
a. “Heading (direction)” parameter is changed beyond assigned
degrees
b. Required “Distance Interval” is reached.

8. Heading OR (Time AND Distance)
The position information is sent back to the base station when
one of the following condition is satisfied:
a. “Heading (direction)” parameter is changed beyond assigned
degrees
b. Required BOTH “Time AND Distance Interval” are satisfied.

9. Heading OR Time OR Distance
The position information is sent whenever one of the following
condition is satisfied:
a. When the “Heading (direction)” parameter is changed
beyond assigned degrees.
b. Required “Time Interval” is reached.
c. Required “Distance Interval” is reached.

fields.name: Time Interval
fields.description:
Specify elapsed time interval to report current position. Default
value is ‘0’. The effective range, please refer to the “mode”
parameters option ‘1’ => “Time mode”.

fields.name: Distance Interval
fields.description:
Specify elapsed distance interval to report current position. Default
value is ‘0’. The effective range, please refer to the “mode”
parameters option ‘2’ => “Distance mode”.

fields.name: Number of Tracking Times
fields.description:
Frequency (number of times the report needs to be sent). Effective
range is from 0~65535.
Set ‘0’ indicating “Continuously tracking.
Note:
The counter of “Times” will be displayed how many times left while
the command is executing when we query the command
parameters.

fields.name: Track Basis
fields.description:
0. Tracking report is sent ONLY IF GPS is fixed.
1. Tracking report is sent regardless the GPS signal reception
2. Track report is sent when ACC is on and GPS is fixed
3. Track report is sent when ACC is on regardless whether the GPS
signal is fixed or not.

fields.name: CommSelect
fields.description:
Set the output communication channel:
1. GSM SMS communication
2. CSD: Circuit Switched Data communication (Reserved, currently
not support)
3. GPRS UDP communication
4. GPRS TCP/IP communication
5. USB port
Note:
Support COM numbers: COM 1~ COM 199 auto detectable.

fields.name: Heading
fields.description: The effective value is from 10~90 degrees.

commands.description:
Execute this command to enable automatically reporting current position to the base
station according to the parameter “mode” and related conditions.

commands.note:
1) This function follows the FIFO (first in first out algorithm) algorithm.
2) The mode 2,3,5,7,and 8 require the GPS reception. If the GPS reception is not
stable then the accuracy will be decreased.
3) “Record Basis” parameter can be set to 1 or 3 when mode is set to 1,4,6,or 9.

fields.name: Mode
fields.description:
0. Disable (Stop storing position data into flash memory)

1. Time mode:
The position information is logged into the memory of the device
according to the required time interval, only integer can be used.
Effective parameters:
Range: 1~65535 seconds.

2. Distance mode:
The position information is logged into the memory of the device
according to the required distance interval, only integer can be
used.
Range: 25~65535 meters.
Note:
For vehicle application, suggest to set 50 meters or above for
better performance.

3. Time AND Distance:
The position information is logged into the memory of the device
according to the required “Time interval” AND “Distance interval”;
the position information is not logged if one of the “Time interval”
and “Distance interval” does not satisfy.

4. Time OR Distance
The position information is logged when one of the following
condition is satisfied:
a. “Time Interval” is reached.
b. “Distance Interval” is reached.

5. Heading mode:
The position information is logged when the “Heading (direction)”
parameter is changed beyond the assigned degrees. Please
enter the required value in the “Heading” column.

6. Heading OR Time
The position information is logged when one of the following
condition is satisfied:
a. “Heading (direction)” parameter is changed beyond the
assigned degrees
b. Required “Time Interval” is reached.

7. Heading OR Distance
The position information is logged whenever one of the following
condition is satisfied:
a. “Heading (direction)” parameter is changed beyond
assigned degrees
b. Required “Distance Interval” is reached.

8. Heading OR (Time AND Distance)
The position information is logged when one of the following
condition is satisfied:
a. “Heading (direction)” parameter is changed beyond assigned
degrees
b. Required BOTH “Time AND Distance Interval” are satisfied.

9. Heading OR Time OR Distance
The position information is logged whenever one of the following
condition is reached:
a. When the “Heading (direction)” parameter is changed
beyond assigned degrees.
b. Required “Time Interval” is reached.
c. Required “Distance Interval” is reached.

fields.name: Time Interval
fields.description:
Specify elapsed time interval to report current position. Default value
is ‘0’. The effective range, please refer to the “mode” parameters
option 1 “Time mode”.

fields.name: Distance Interval
fields.description:
Specify elapsed distance interval to report current position. Default
value is ‘0’. The effective range, please refer to the “mode”
parameters option 2 “Distance mode”.

fields.name: Number of Times
fields.description:
Frequency (number of times the report needs to be sent). Effective
range is from 0~65535.
Set ‘0’ indicating “Continuously logging”.
Note:
The counter of “Times” will be displayed how many times left while
the command is executing when we query the command parameters.

fields.name: Record Basis
fields.description:
0. Logging function is executed ONLY IF GPS is fixed.
1. Logging function is executed regardless the GPS signal reception.
2. Logging function is executed when ACC is on and GPS is fixed.
3. Logging function is executed when ACC is on regardless whether
the GPS signal is fixed or not.

fields.name: Heading
fields.description: The effective value is from 10~90 degrees.

commands.description:
Execute this command to enable automatically logging current position into the
memory of the device according to the parameter “Mode” and corresponding
conditions.
Execute this command to erase all logging data from the memory of the device.

fields.name:
Start
Date/Time
fields.description:
Format of this parameter: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS or ‘0’ (please refer to
the “Note” section for detail)

fields.name:
End
Date/time
fields.description:
Format of this parameter: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS or ‘0’ (please refer to
the “Note” section for detail)

commands.description:
Execute this command to download request logging data from the memory of the
device
Execute this command to stop downloading process
Execute this command to reboot the device. All setting will be remained.

Execute this command to reset the device to factory default settings or pre-set
settings

fields.name: Low Voltage
fields.description:
Set the voltage for the main power low report.
Effective range: 0.00~30.00 V; Default voltage level: 11.50V

fields.name: Polling
fields.description:
If any of specific report triggered then the report will be sent back to
the control center. This setting is based on the bitwise operation. This
parameter can specify what report would be available. The bitwise
definition is following (default setting:127) :
0. Disable
1. Input 1
2. Input 2
4. Input 3
8. Input 4
16. Main power low
32. Main power lost
64. Internal battery voltage low
256.Main power voltage recover
512.Main power recover
1024. Internal battery voltage recover

fields.name: Loggin
fields.description:
If any of specific report triggered then report will be stored into the
device memory and can be downloaded later. This setting is based
on the bitwise operation. This parameter can specify what report
would be available. The bitwise definition is following:
0. Disable
1. Input 1
2. Input 2
4. Input 3
8. Input 4
16. Main power low
32. Main power lost
64. Internal battery voltage low
256.Main power voltage recover
512.Main power recover
1024. Internal battery voltage recover

commands.description:
Execute this command to enable/disable the default event sending for input
triggering, main power voltage low/lost, and internal backup battery voltage
low/recover.

fields.name: Mode
fields.description:
0: Disable the defined report.
1: Enable report/Enable SMS Roaming:
As soon as the User-Defined-Report triggered, the report will be
sent back to the GSM SMS Base Station while the device is in
roaming area.
2: Enable report/Block SMS Roaming: As soon as the
User-Defined-Report triggered, the report will NOT be sent back to
the GSM SMS Base Station and will be put in the queue buffer
while it is on the roaming. As soon as the device returns back to
home GSM network then the report will be sent back to the GPRS
server.

fields.name: Longitude
fields.description: The longitude of center point of defined circle zone.

fields.name: Latitude
fields.description: The latitude of center point of defined circle zone.

fields.name: Radius
fields.description:
The radius of the circle zone. The effective range is from 50 to 65535
meters.

fields.name: Zone Control
fields.description:
0. Disable
1. Inside Zone
The event will be sent when the GPS coordinate is inside the
defined zones.
2. Outside Zone
The event will be sent when the GPS coordinate is outside the
defined zones.
Important Note:
This parameter is no longer as used for reference. Zone
Control (Inside Zone or Outside Zone) will be determined by
the “Function Control” or “Trigger Control” parameters

fields.name: Actions
fields.description:
This parameter is to define the actions when the conditions become
true. The following actions are available:
1. Logging:
When the conditions of the defined report are true then the device
will store the current GPS position information for the specify event
into the memory.
2. Polling:
When the conditions of the defined report are true then the device
will send the current GPS position information for the specify event
back to the base station.
3. Logging and Polling:
When the conditions of the defined report are true then
the device will store the current GPS position information
for specific event into memory and send the event back to
the base station as well.

fields.name:
Function
Used
fields.description:
This parameter can specify what input port is used as the input
condition for this specific report. This setting is based on the
bitwise operation. The definitions are :
0. Disable
1. Input 1
2. Input 2
4. Input 3
8. input 4
16. IG Detection
32” Output 1
64: Output 2
128: Output 3
256: Output 4
512: Geo-fencing
1024: Scheduling
2048: GPS is fixed
4096: GSM is registered
8192: GPRS is connected
16384: Enter GPRS roaming area.
32768: G-Sensor triggering (movement detected).

fields.name:
Function
Control
fields.description:
This parameter is used to specify the input port which defines in
the “Input Control” parameters which must be “ON” state.
0. Disable
1. Input 1
2. Input 2
4. Input 3
8. Input 4
16. IG Detection
32: Output 1
64: Output 2
128: Output 3
256: Output 4
512: Geo-fencing (inside zone)
1024: Scheduling (inside schedule)
2048: GPS is fixed
4096: GSM is registered
8192: GPRS is connected 16384: Enter GPRS roaming area.
32768: G-Sensor triggering (movement detected).
Note:
1. Remaining “Function Used in the “Function Used” must be
“opposite” state as the input triggering condition.
2. If “IG Detection” is selected, then input 1 is available for
connecting a sensor other than ACC of the vehicle.
3. “Inside Zone”, “Outside Zone”, ‘Inside Schedule”, and
“Outside Schedule” will be controlled by the “Function
Control” parameter.

fields.name: Output Port
fields.description:
This parameter can specify what output port will be used when
the condition(s) of the event is true. The setting is based on the
bitwise operation and the definitions is following:
0. Disable
1. Output 1
2. Output 2
4. Output 3
8. Output 4

fields.name:
Output
Control
fields.description:
This parameter can specify what output port will be activated to
“On” or “Off” when the condition(s) of the event is true. The
setting is based on the bitwise operation and the definitions is
following:
0. Disable
1. Output 1
2. Output 2
4. Output 3
8. Output 4

fields.name:
Output
Toggle
Duration
fields.description:
Effective range: 0~65535 100ms
Note:
Both “Output Toggle Duration” and “Output Toggle Times”
parameters should be ‘0’ or value other than ‘0’ at the same time.

fields.name:
Output
Toggle
Times
fields.description:
Effective Range 0~65535 times
Note:
Both “Output Toggle Duration” and “Output Toggle Times”
parameters should be ‘0’ or value other than ‘0’ at the same time.

fields.name:
SMS VIP
Mask
fields.description:
If the event is triggered then the device could send a SMS alert to
up to 5 different pre-defined SMS phone number. The SMS VIP
is defined in the $WP+SETVIP command.
The bitwise definition is following:
0. Disable
1. SMS VIP 1
2. SMS VIP 2
4. SMS VIP 3
8. SMS VIP 4
16. SMS VIP 5
Ex:
Set to 12 means enabled (SMS VIP 3 + SMS VIP 4)

fields.name: Sat Used
fields.description:
Valid value 0~12
Note:
If the number of satellite is less or equal to defined number then
the report will not be executed.

fields.name:
Schedule
Control
fields.description:
0: Disable
1: Inside Schedule
2: Outside Schedule
Important Note:
This parameter is no longer used for reference.
Schedule Control (Inside Schedule or Outside schedule)
will be determined by the “Function Control” or “Trigger
Control” parameters

fields.name:
Day of the
week
fields.description:
1: Sunday
2: Monday
4: Tuesday
8: Wednesday
16:Thursday
32: Friday
64: Saturday

fields.name:
Schedule Start
Time
fields.description:
Format: HHMMSS
HH indicates hours: 00~23
MM indicates minutes: 00~59
SS indicates seconds: 00~59

fields.name:
Schedule
End Time
fields.description:
Format: HHMMSS
HH indicates hours: 00~23
MM indicates minutes: 00~59
SS indicates seconds: 00~59

fields.name: Trigger Used
fields.description:
1: input 1
2: input 2
4: input 3
8: Input 4
16: IG
32: Output 1
64: Output 2
128: Output 3
256: Output 4
512: Geo-fencing
1024: Scheduling
2048: GPS is fixed
4096: GSM is registered
8192: GPRS is connected
16384: Enter GPRS roaming area.
32768: G-Sensor triggering (movement detected).

fields.name:
Trigger
Control
fields.description:
1: input 1
2: input 2
4: input 3
8: Input 4
16: IG
32: Output 1
64: Output 2
128: Output 3
256: Output 4
512: Geo-fencing (Inside Zone)
1024: Scheduling (Inside Schedule)
2048: GPS is fixed
4096: GSM is registered
8192: GPRS is connected
16384: Enter GPRS roaming area.
32768: G-Sensor triggering (movement detected).

fields.name:
Trigger Delay
Time Interval
fields.description:
This time interval is to specify the delay time for “”Trigger
Used” and “Trigger Control”. After the “Trigger Used”,
“ Trigger Control”, and “Delay” time are all satisfied then it
will check the conditions “Geo-fencing”, “Input/Output
Used
Effective range: 0~65535 second

commands.description:
Execute this command to set GEO-Fencing, input triggered/output control, and report
schedule

fields.name: VIP 1
fields.description: Set VIP number 1

fields.name: VIP 2
fields.description: Set VIP number 2

fields.name: VIP 3
fields.description: Set VIP number 3

fields.name: VIP 4
fields.description: Set VIP number 4

fields.name: VIP 5
fields.description: Set VIP number 5

commands.description:
Execute this command to set up to 5 different mobile phone numbers for the user
defined reports.

fields.name: Enable/Disable
fields.description:
0: Disable
1: Enable

fields.name: Voltage threshold of ACC off
fields.description: Effective range: 0.0~30.0V

fields.name: Voltage threshold of ACC on
fields.description: Effective range: 0.0~30.0V

fields.name: Duration
fields.description: Effective range: 0~65535 seconds

commands.description:
Execute this command to define voltage level of vehicle battery to detect the ACC
on/off event.

fields.name:
Set/Query
Current Voltage
fields.description: Effective range: 0.00~30.00V

commands.description:
Execute this command to calibrate the difference between the voltage reading of the
device and the exact voltage level before device installation. This action is suggested
to be done after resetting the device, uploading the firmware, or installing a new
device (if the SACC command is used). Once the voltage is calibrated then all related
voltage level detection such as main power low/recover report, engine on/off report,
etc would be based on the calibrated voltage reading.

fields.name: Mode
fields.description:
0: Disable
1: Stop sending messages with “Event ID” message. (All inputs and
outputs state will not be changed even though the condition of
user-defined report becomes true.)
2. Stop sending messages with “Event ID” message. (All inputs and
outputs state will be changed if the condition of user-defined
report becomes true.)

commands.description:
Execute this command to enable or disable sending all returning messages with
“Event ID” information back to control center. Other commands such as “$WP+VER”
would be working normally.

fields.name: Event ID
fields.description:
Specify the report identifier which will be cleared.
The effective identifier range is from 100~149.
255: clear all $WP+SETEVT settings.

commands.description: Execute this command to clear single/all event settings
Execute this command to clear queue buffer
Execute this command to query the IMEI No. for the internal GSM module
Execute this command to query the identification number of the SIM card

commands.note: 1. The command is available after the device registered to the GSM/GPRS network.

fields.name: GSM Operator
fields.description: Name of the Telecommunication corp.

fields.name: GSM signal strength
fields.description:
This parameter indicates the signal strength
for GSM network. The closer the value
approaches to 31, the stronger the signal is.
CSQ dBm
0 -113dBm or less
1 -111dBm
2..30 -109…-53dBm
31 -51dBm or greater
99 not known or not detectable

fields.name: GPRS Status
fields.description:
0:GPRS is not connected
1: GPRS is connected

fields.name: Roaming Status
fields.description:
0: Currently is in home GSM/GPRS network.
1: Currently is in roaming GSM/GPRS network

commands.description:
Execute this command to query the Name of the operator, GSM signal strength,
GPRS connection status, and Roaming status.

fields.name: Auto Mode
fields.description:
0: Disable
1: The event will be sent whenever the information (LAC and CI) is
changed regardless GPS reception
2: The event will be sent whenever the information (LAC and CI) is
changed if there is no GPS reception.

fields.name: Device ID
fields.description: Identification of the device

fields.name: Date Time
fields.description:
Date and Time
(Base on the Time Zone setting)

fields.name: LAC
fields.description: Location area code

fields.name: CI
fields.description: Cell ID

commands.description:
Execute this command to query or set “auto-reporting” function of the close GSM BTS
location information

commands.note:
1. If the parameter “Basis” sets to 2, then the input 1 must connect to ACC of the vehicle
or $WP+SACC command must be enabled.
2. The maximum number of Cell ID is 7 sets; only sensed Cell ID will be displayed
3. Due to limited length (less than 160 characters), only 5 sets of Cell ID will be
displayed if GSM communication is chosen.
4. The command is available after the device registered to the GSM/GPRS network.

fields.name: Time
fields.description:
he position information is sent to the base station according to the
required time interval, only whole number can be used.
Effective range for different communication types:
0: Disable
Direct Connection: 1~65535 seconds.
GSM SMS: 15~65535 seconds
GSM CSD: 5~65535 seconds
GPRS UDP/TCP/IP: 5~65535 seconds.

fields.name: Number of Times
fields.description:
Frequency (number of times the event needs to be sent). Effective
range is from 0~65535.
Set ‘0’ indicating “Continuously tracking.
Note:
The counter of “Times” will be displayed how many times left while the
command is executing when we query the command parameters.

fields.name: Basis
fields.description:
0. Event will be sent regardless the state of ACC or GPS.
1. Event will be sent if there is no GPS reception.
2. Event will be sent only if ACC of vehicle is on.

fields.name: CommSelect
fields.description:
Set the output communication channel:
1: GSM SMS communication
2: CSD: Circuit Switched Data communication
(Reserved, currently not support)
3: GPRS UDP communication
4: GPRS TCP/IP communication
5: USB port
Note:
Support COM numbers: COM 1~ COM 199 auto detectable

fields.name: Device ID
fields.description: Device ID of the device

fields.name: Date Time
fields.description:
Date and Time
(Base on the Time Zone setting)

fields.name: Satellite
fields.description: Number of satellites fixed

fields.name: Input Status
fields.description: Status of input port

fields.name: Analog 1
fields.description: Status of analog port 1

fields.name: Analog 2
fields.description: Status of analog port 2

fields.name: Output status
fields.description: Status of output port

fields.name: Cell ID Info.
fields.description:
This parameter contains the information of 7
different Cell IDs. For each Cell ID, it provide the
following items:
Mobile country code :3 digits
Mobile network code :3 digits
Location area code :4 digits
Cell ID: 4 digits
RSSI (Received Signal Strength indication 0~63) :
2 digits

commands.description:
(Only for Siemens module) Execute this command to query GSM BTS location information (up to 7 different Cell
ID)

Execute this command to query the current firmware and hardware version of the
device.

commands.note:
1. If the Speeding mode ‘1’ is selected, when the conditions of speeding report are
satisfied (speeding) or not satisfied (no speeding), the report only sending once.
For example, issue $WP+SPD=0000,1,60,120,15,0,0,1,30
If the vehicle speed is 70 KPH for 40 seconds, the Event (ID 3) would be sent once
in the first 15 seconds. Then if the speed is down to 40 KPH for 20 minutes, then
the Event (ID 9) would be sent once in the first 15 seconds.
2. If we need only using one specific speed as the condition (send Event ID 3 above
the speed for defined interval and send Event ID 9 below the speed for defined
interval) then we can set the specific speed condition in “Minimum Speed”
parameter and set the speed which is not possible to reach in the “Maximum
Speed” parameters.
For example, issue $WP+SPD=0000,3,120,255,15,0,0,1,30
The device will generate a Speeding Event (ID 3) as the vehicle speed is over 120
for 15 seconds and a Speeding Event (ID 9) as the vehicle speed is below 120 for
30 seconds.
3. If the “Speeding Mode” sets to ‘0’, like $WP+SPD=0000,3,120,255,15,0,0,0,0 then
the speeding report (ID 3) will be sent every 15 seconds when the vehicle speed is
between 120 and 255 KPH continuously.
4. In the Speeding Mode ‘1’, the Event ID 9 will be sent if the ACC is off.
For example, issue $WP+SPD=0000,3,120,255,15,0,0,1,30. As the speed is lower
than 120 KPH for only 20 seconds but the ACC is off, the device will generate an
Event ID 9.

fields.name: Mode
fields.description:
This parameter is to define the actions when the conditions become
true. The following actions are available:
0. Disable
1. Logging:
When the conditions of the defined event are true then the device
will store the current GPS position information for the specify event
into the memory.
2. Polling:
When the conditions of the defined event are true then the device
will send the current GPS position information for the specify event
back to the base station.
3. Logging and Polling:
When the conditions of the defined event are true then the device
will store the current GPS position information for specific event
into memory and send the event back to the base station as well.

fields.name:
Minimum
Speed
fields.description:
Set Minimum Speed.
Valid range: 0~255 km/hr.

fields.name:
Maximum
Speed
fields.description:
Set Maximum Speed.
Valid range: 0~255 km/hr

fields.name:
Speeding
Duration
fields.description:
The parameter defined the time duration to activate the speeding
event (Event ID 3).
In Speeding Mode ‘0’, the range: 15~65535 seconds
In Speeding Mode ‘1’, the range: 0~ 65535 seconds

fields.name: Output Port
fields.description:
This parameter can specify what output port is activated when
the condition(s) of the event is true. The definitions are
following:
0. Disable
1. Output 1
2. Output 2
3. Output 3
4. Output 4

fields.name:
Output
Control
fields.description:
This parameter is to set the output state to 0 (off) or 1(on) of
the defined output port in the “Output Port” parameter.
0. Off
1.On

fields.name:
Speeding
Mode
fields.description:
0: As the GPS speed is in the defined range, the device will send
Event ID 3 according to the defined duration continually.
1: Enter and End speeding reports:
- As the GPS speed is in the defined range for the defined duration,
Event ID 3 will be sent once.
- As the GPS speed is out the defined range for the defined duration,
Event ID 9 will be sent once.

fields.name:
Off-speeding
Duration
fields.description:
The parameter defined the time duration to activate the off-speeding
event (Event ID 9).
In Speeding Mode ‘0’, this parameter is disabled.
In Speeding Mode ‘1’, the range: 0~ 65535 seconds

commands.description:
Execute this command to enable the speeding event. If the vehicle speed is in/out the
speeding range (between minimum and maximum speed) for the certain time period
(Duration) then it will trigger the speeding event.

commands.label: Output

fields.name: Output Control
fields.description:
This parameter is to set the output state to 0 (off) or 1(on) of the
defined output port in the “Output Port” parameter.
0.Off
1. On

fields.name:
Output Toggle
Duration
fields.description:
To define the time interval of the specific output port staying in
the specific state.
Effective range: 0~65535 100ms.
Ex:
255 100ms = 25.5 seconds

fields.name:
Output Toggle
Times
fields.description:
To define the times of the specific output port changing from
current state to alternative state and back to the original state
after reaching the duration.
Effective range: 0~65535 times.

commands.description: Execute this command to set the output behavior.

fields.description:
0.Disable
1.Enable

1.Logging
2.Polling
3.Logging + Polling

fields.name: Satellite Fixed
fields.description: Effective range: 3~12

fields.name: Tow Duration
fields.description: 30~65535 seconds

fields.name:
Auto Reset
Duration
fields.description:
The Tow function will be re-enabled when reaching the end of
“Auto Reset Duration” after the first tow event is triggered.
0~65535 seconds

fields.name: Mode
fields.description:

1. Mileage will be accumulated regardless the ACC status.
2. Mileage will be accumulated only if the ACC is on.

commands.description:

set up to 3 times per day.

fields.description:
+: ahead GMT time
-: behind GMT time

fields.description: Offset hours. Effective range is from 00~13

fields.description:
Offset minute (based on 15 minutes basis). Please select one of
following:
00,15,30,45

commands.description:
Execute this command to setup the local time. The time of returning message will be
based on the time zone setting. The default time zone is the GMT time.

commands.description: Execute this command to enable the external GPS antenna cut off alert.

fields.name: SETVIP Mask
fields.description:
Activate the SMS phone No. which will be accepted by the unit
to return a current position of the unit when receive a call or SMS
with string “XPOS” from the activating SMS phone No. The SMS
Phone numbers are configured by the $WP+SETVIP command.
This parameter is using bitwise algorithm and the definition is
following:
0. Disable
1. SMS VIP 1
2. SMS VIP 2
4. SMS VIP 3
8. SMS VIP 4
16. SMS VIP 5
Ex:
Set to 12 means enabled (SMS VIP 3 + SMS VIP 4)

parameters should be ‘0’ or value other than ‘0’ at the same time.

Output Toggle
Times

Both “Output Toggle Duration” and “Output Toggle Times”
parameters should be ‘0’ or value other than ‘0’ at the same time.

current position of the unit by making a call or sending a SMS (content of the
SMS must be “XPOS”).

and generate a “Motion Report” if movement is detected while in sleeping state.

fields.name: Mode
fields.description:
0: Disable
1: Logging
2: Polling

commands.description:
Execute this command to enable/disable the GPRS connection and sleeping report for
power saving mode.

fields.name: Enable/Disable
fields.description:
0: Disable the function key.
1: Enable report/Enable SMS Roaming: As soon as the Function
Key triggered, the report will be sent back to the GSM SMS Base
Station while the device is in roaming area.
2: Enable report/Block SMS Roaming: As soon as the Function
Key triggered, the report will NOT be sent back to the GSM SMS
Base Station and will be put in the queue buffer while it is on the
roaming. As soon as the device returns back to home GSM
network then the report will be sent back to the GPRS server.

fields.name: Mode
fields.description:
1: Logging
2: Polling
3: Logging + Polling

fields.name: Output Port
fields.description:
0: Not Used
1: Output 1
2: Output 2
4: Output 3
8: Output 4

fields.name: Output Control
fields.description:
This parameter can specify what output port will be activated to
“On” or “Off” when the condition(s) of the event is true. The setting
is based on the bitwise operation and the definitions is following:
0. Disable
1. Output 1
2. Output 2
4. Output 3
8. Output 4

fields.name:
Output Toggle
Duration
fields.description:
Effective range 0~65535 100ms.
Note: Both “Output Toggle Duration” and “Output Toggle Times”
parameters should be ‘0’ or value other than ‘0’ at the same time.

fields.name:
Output Toggle
Times
fields.description:
Effective Range 0~65535 times.
Note: Both “Output Toggle Duration” and “Output Toggle Times”
parameters should be ‘0’ or value other than ‘0’ at the same time.

fields.name:
Trigger Delay
Time Interval
fields.description:
Effective range: 0~65535 seconds.
This Time Interval is to specify the delay time for Function Key
press and hold. After the “Trigger Delay” time is satisfied the report
will be sent back to the GSM SMS Base Station according to
“Mode 0: Disable”, “Mode 1: Enable report/Enable SMS Roaming”
or “Mode 2: Enable report/Block SMS Roaming” settings.

commands.description:
Execute this command to enable/disable the Function Key report (external SOS
button).

1. Supports $WP+SETEVT command (Event ID 100~119)
2.. Please use the 255 to clear all labels.
i.e. $WP+LABEL=0000,255

fields.name: Text
fields.description:
- Maximum text length is 12 chars.
- Use “ “ to clear the existing defined text.

commands.description:
Execute this command to set the header of SMS alert for each
User-Defined-Event ($WP+SETEVT) and Event ID in the $WP+SETDR
command

fields.name: Phone number
fields.description: The specific phone number which the device will call out. This phone number supports the international phone calls

commands.description: Execute this command to enable voice wiretapping function. Once the device receives this command then it will call out to the assigned phone number automatically. The device will enable microphone and disable speaker function once the phone line is connected. Thus, the user’s conversation will be monitored by the assigned phone number. This function will be disabled automatically once the phone line has been hung up.
